notes: Prepared for quote solicitation; not a final statement of work until bidder Q&A closes.
Crop genotype availability, shipping permits, and biosafety approvals must be confirmed before PO issuance.
All quote recipients should return explicit attrition assumptions and event-level QC deliverables.

target_labs.name: Danforth Center Plant Transformation Facility
target_labs.fit_summary: High fit for sorghum and switchgrass transformation, with academic/commercial service model.

target_labs.name: University of Missouri Plant Transformation Core Facility
target_labs.fit_summary: Offers fee-based service for external/commercial users and supports sorghum/switchgrass transformation pathways.

target_labs.name: PlantEdits LLC
target_labs.fit_summary: Commercial plant engineering provider with published transformation service scope and contact channel.

rfq_packages.title: RFQ: Editing Transformation-Competence Determinants in Recalcitrant Bioenergy Crop Genotypes
rfq_packages.objective: Increase stable transformation efficiency in recalcitrant elite lines via targeted edits to competence-associated loci.
scope_of_work: Design/build up to 2 multiplex CRISPR constructs plus one non-targeting control (Wave 1 scope).
Agrobacterium-mediated transformation in one transformable control genotype and up to two recalcitrant genotypes.
Selection, regeneration, and event tracking to independent-event level.
Molecular QC: target edit confirmation, transgene presence, copy-number estimate, backbone integration screen.
Deliver analyzable event-level dataset and summary report.
client_provided_inputs: Final prioritized locus list (4-6 loci) and preferred guide constraints
Genotype list and seed/tissue source details
Any existing validated vector backbones and selectable marker preferences
Preferred reporting template and analysis conventions
required_deliverables: Independent event inventory with unique IDs and batch provenance
Per-event QC table: target locus edit call, transgene status, copy estimate, backbone check
Regeneration and survival metrics by arm
Raw instrument/output files and processed tables in machine-readable format
acceptance_criteria: At least 8 independent PCR-positive events delivered per construct-genotype arm unless pre-agreed attrition exception is triggered
Event-level QC table provided for all delivered events
Matched-control analysis supports go/no-go call on >=2x efficiency lift criterion
Any protocol deviations and failed batches documented with timestamps and root-cause notes
quote_requirements: Fixed fee by milestone and explicit variable-cost triggers
Expected attrition model from explants to analyzable events
Guaranteed minimum event count per arm and remediation path if under-delivered
Turnaround for first analyzable dataset (calendar weeks)
Permit/logistics responsibilities (who handles shipping/permits and at what cost)
IP terms, data rights, and sample destruction/return policy

rfq_packages.title: RFQ: Safe-Harbor Locus and Insulator Validation for Stable Transgene Expression
rfq_packages.objective: Identify locus/insulator combinations that reduce between-line expression variance while preserving mean reporter expression.
scope_of_work: Wave 1 matrix: 2 candidate loci x (no-insulator + one insulator condition) plus random-integration comparator.
Construct assembly and delivery using Agrobacterium pathway and agreed targeted insertion strategy.
Event generation and pre-assay QC gating (junction PCR, copy estimate, locus confirmation).
Expression assay execution (dual-luciferase and qPCR support) across defined T0/T1 tissue panel.
Return line-level expression dataset and variance analysis-ready outputs.
client_provided_inputs: Candidate safe-harbor coordinates and sequence context
Insulator sequence set and cassette architecture preferences
Reporter assay SOP preferences and normalization schema
Target tissue panel for T0/T1 measurements
required_deliverables: Per-event insertion QC package (5' and 3' junction verification, copy estimate, locus call)
Assay enrollment log showing which events passed QC gating
Line-level ratiometric expression table with tissue, generation, and batch annotations
Comparator analysis versus random integration arm
Final recommendation matrix ranking locus/insulator combinations
acceptance_criteria: Minimum independent event counts per arm delivered per quoted commitment
All analyzed lines have complete insertion QC records
Returned dataset supports direct computation of between-line CV and stability metrics
Bidder provides explicit caveats where power is insufficient for specific contrasts
quote_requirements: Detailed assumptions for targeted insertion success rates and rework policy
Milestone-based cost breakdown including assay costs and failed-event handling
Timeline to first T0 assay data and timeline to T1 follow-up
Definition of deliverable formats (raw + processed), QA checks, and transfer mechanism
IP/data rights, confidentiality, and publication clauses

outreach_templates.subject: RFQ Request: opc-go-001 crop transformation/editing study
outreach_templates.body:
Hello {lab_name},

We are requesting a quote for a staged crop transformation/editing study (RFQ ID: rfq-opc-go-001-v1).

We are attaching the scope, deliverables, and acceptance criteria. Please return:
1) milestone-based pricing,
2) expected event-yield/attrition assumptions,
3) timeline to first analyzable dataset, and
4) any required clarifications or exclusions.

Questions deadline: 2026-02-18
Quote due: 2026-02-25

Thank you,
{sender_name}
{organization}
{contact_info}

outreach_templates.subject: RFQ Request: opc-go-002 safe-harbor/insulator validation
outreach_templates.body:
Hello {lab_name},

We are requesting a quote for a targeted insertion + expression stability study (RFQ ID: rfq-opc-go-002-v1).

Please review the attached scope and provide:
1) milestone-based pricing,
2) insertion success and attrition assumptions,
3) timeline for T0 and T1 data delivery, and
4) required client inputs or constraints.

Questions deadline: 2026-02-18
Quote due: 2026-02-25

Thank you,
{sender_name}
{organization}
{contact_info}
